Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band cup; interior glazed black; exterior, in handle zone, from left: chest (with added red) and forelegs of sphinx to right, and deer or goat (forelegs and one hind leg, part of chest in red and belly) walking to left; black on wall below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "b" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0443) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
